Reviews.Title: “Not great, but clean”
Reviews.Author: MADDIE J
Reviews.Content: The room was clean and seemed to be updated. It was super small though and walls are paper thin. I could here the next room's conversation,every word! It was very uncomfortable especially being on your honeymoon. Staff was not friendly, they seemed to be in a hurry when checking us in and we were the only ones there. I would have much rather had good friendly service than a "speedy" check in. Also our cable kept going out and everytime it did it made a LOUD noise. Don't eat the breakfast unless you want cold biscuits and cereal

Reviews.Title: “Branson Baymont”
Reviews.Author: CONSTANCE S
Reviews.Content: Convenient location to downtown and show venues. Personable, helpful staff, and good cookies helped the enjoyment. The breakfast could have had more choices, such as multiple fruit options, but the food was adequate. I had to stand to use the computer on a high counter, but appreciated its availability. Overall a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “New updates, good breakfast, a few minor issues.”
Reviews.Author: xbrandpure
Reviews.Content: Found a great rate on this 2 star in Branson. Location was good, near Hwy 65, right on the strip, and just down the street from the Landing. When we got to the hotel, we checked in with David, who was very friendly our two nights there. Check-in was fast. However, when we got up to the room we noticed a strange smell right away. It wasn't overpowering, but still very noticeable, so much so that we didn't want to stay in that room for 2 nights. We called down to David, and he got us another room, which was much better. Rooms were nice, seemed recently updated. However, as a review before mentions, the showers are very small. Not what you would normally get at a hotel. But, all was clean and comfortable. Besides the shower, our only other concern was the TV in the room, which had horrible signal. We lost signal every few mintues sometimes, and at first we were not even able to get the tv to turn on. Not wanting to move again, I pulled the dresser out and unpluggd the tv, and plugged in back in myself, which seemed to fix the problem. But the reception was still bad, which was frustrating. Didn't use the pool, but it seemed nice for kids. Fitness room was small but sufficent for running/walking. No weights or anything. Breakfast was good. Hard-boiled eggs, biscuits and gravy, waffles, fruit, cereal, juice, etc. Because of our issues with the first room, the shower, and the tv, I'm just giving an average rating. But the service was great, rooms were clean, location was good, and the value was great.

Reviews.Title: “Not Happy”
Reviews.Author: ChrisPaulsen
Reviews.Content: The shower was horrible. I am a 5ft. 7in. tall 150lb. female (small frame) and this shower was so small I could not wash my hair, I could not bend over, I couldn't even reach my legs to shave. My husband being larger than myself at 235lbs. his shoulders touched each wall. The shower head was so short he and myself had to try to bend down to rinse our hair, (couldn't really bend so had to finish in the bathroom sink). It was the WORST shower I have ever seen!!! The window in the room did not open. The air conditioner did not work and the condensor leaked so the carpet on that side of the bed was soaking wet. The only nice thing we liked were the people who worked there were very nice, and they had rooms that allowed pets ( but ours was made an exception since they typically only allow dogs 30lbs or less - our pet is 60lbs.).

Reviews.Title: “Relatively inexpensive lodging on the "Branson Strip"”
Reviews.Author: rgrippo
Reviews.Content: Stayed while conducting business at the Bull Shoals Field Station. First time to Branson; what an eye-opener! Hotel located pretty much at the southern end of the Strip so it was convenient to both the strip attractions and Branson Landing downtown by the river. Overall nice clean room, nothing real fancy except I had a King room which came with a Jacuzzi which I did not use because it was very hot (103+) when I was there. Room was clean, modern and comfortable. Staff were very friendly and helpful, especially with directing me around bad traffic spots and to local (non-chain) places to eat. Exercise room and pool were quite modest. Breakfast was the standard fare continental with the exception of a can of whipped cream and some strawberries with heavy syrup by the waffle machine; this made them into "Belgian Waffles". After my 1st morning I just took advantage of the many fine breakfast buffets available on the Strip. Worst part about the experience was getting on and off the property. It is on a busy road and you had to be very aggressive to get out and turn left without getting creamed. Overall I recommend this property

Reviews.Title: “Some Issues”
Reviews.Author: Ryan N
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in July of 2012 as a small getaway with a couple of friends. The location is quite nice, being right off of 65. When we arrived in our room I noticed it was nicely updated, but quickly noticed some issues. The bedding on our beds had some stains, the wallpaper in our room above one of the beds appeared to already be pealing off, and the air conditioner would not stay running longer then 5 minutes before shutting off. After checking in we left and arrived back at the hotel around 11 P.M., when I entered the lobby I was greeted by an older gentleman and I asked if we could have some extra pillows and blankets for our room. I was told by him that I was in "luck" and that he only had one pillow left and hardly any blankets. I have never stayed at a hotel that ran out of pillows and blankets and I was left kind of baffled. The next day the water was shut off at the hotel for around two hours due to a washing machine being broken, which was kind of inconvenient. Upon checkout on the third day, I had to use the stairs to go and fetch the elevator as it kept skipping our floor. The biggest problem overall was the speed of the elevator, it was extremely slow and it was always faster to take the stairs; that felt as if they were not air conditioned.

Reviews.Title: “Aged but nice”
Reviews.Author: Stephanie C
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a older one but a wonderful location. Rooms were updated and clean. Staff was friendly and helpful. Breakfast was great on the weekend, during the week it was lacking a lot. Pool was disapointing. Small maybe 12 people max and no hot tub (due to a crack). Overall, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best Hotels that I've stayed at in Branson”
Reviews.Author: BigBroChuck
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night, but had a great experience. It was my husband, myself and our 2 children. Our room was clean. You can tell it is an older hotel, but they've done a lot of rennovations. This hotel used to be a Holiday Inn Express. The kids loved the pool. The best part is how friendly the entire staff was. At checkin, the front desk attendant introduced himself by name and told us he would be there all night. The servers at breakfast in the morning were also very friendly and accomadating. We all had a good night's sleep, and great breakfast the next morning. Definately will be going back to the Baymont!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, great location, standard breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: Nayken
Reviews.Content: I was impressed with the updating that had been done to the hotel and the rooms. The only places I could tell it was an older hotel were in the Elevator, the ceiling in the bathroom and the stairwells. Everything else had been updated, carpet, linens, curtains, appliances, flat screen TV, granite in the bathroom, etc. The shower/bathtub combo had a whirlpool tub(standard bath size - nothing you could stretch out in). The breakfast was standard, waffles, cereal, muffins, bagels, oatmeal, apples, yogurt, coffee, tea, juice & milk. The breakfast area included a large flat screen television and copies of USA Today. An odd surprise at breakfast...there was a "show" that came into the breakfast room and sang a song and passed out fliers. The staff was extremely helpful and very courteous at all times (booking the reservation, questions, check-in, etc.). I did not use the indoor pool, but it was a small pool, no hot tub. The facility also had ice machines, soda vending machines and coin operated laundry in the stairwells. The location is great very close to downtown and at the intersection of Hwy 76 and Hwy 65. I even received a conference discount for a conference that was being held at the Hilton Convention Center!

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: Tonya F
Reviews.Content: I was pleasently surprised by this stay. I the room was very clean and the staff was very friendly. I only had 2 complaints -the tub in our room was a whirlpool but there was a crack in it that had some type of putty over it which was coming off I,m sure it was OK but was just not attractive and - the breakfast was a little lacking. The hotel did offer fresh waffles but there was nothing else that we found tempting like fruit or yogert. This was my first stay at this hotel but will not be my last. Although I had some complaints the property was nice and worked out really well for my family of 4.

Reviews.Title: “I had fun and felt safe and comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: MizConnolly
Reviews.Content: The bed was a bit hard but there was nothing else remotely lacking. The jacuzzi tub for two was nice for our honeymoon.

Reviews.Title: “Breakfast Hostess”
Reviews.Author: StephinPR
Reviews.Content: Absolutely wonderful! Our hostess, Mary C., did everything she could to make our stay and especially the start of our day wonderful! She helped us not only with breakfast but with tips on shows and the best deals in the area. Thanks, Mary & Lisa!

Reviews.Title: “Good Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: thanks135
Reviews.Content: Very convenient location, close to highway, on the strip - but at beginning not in middle of strip - easy to find. Very friendly and accommodating staff. Good breakfast (including waffles, not frozen biscuits). Enjoyed pool, exercise room, and use of internet. Evening clerk gave us good recommendations on restaurants. Only problem was the card keys are VERY sensitive and everytime we tried to get into room, we had to struggle to get either of our keys to work! Would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Missing the hot tub!”
Reviews.Author: Warren K
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay. We have stayed there the last five times we have been to Branson. Hotel has a little age to it, but is clean and the staff has alway been helpful and friendly! We have a family with kids 5 and 3. They love the swimming pool and hot tub. The last time we stayed was great except that the hot tub was closed and boarded over. Would love to continue staying here but will definitely check on the status of the hot tub prior to booking. Also the room came with jet bath tub, but there was a hole in the tub that had been poorly patched and had cracked back through the patch so that you could not fill the tub very high to use the jets. With two little ones a hot tub or at least a jet tub are a must! Of all the times we have stayed we have never had any problems with anything being broken or not working until now. Hopefully they get these fixed, so we can continue to stay here. Overall I would rate this hotel as a great place to stay, provided they make a few fixes and updates!

Reviews.Title: “What a surprise!”
Reviews.Author: racpie
Reviews.Content: My family of 4 stayed 4 nights here and it was lovely. Great price, Nicely decorated, comfy beds, nice pool, good breakfast, friendly staff and perfect location. We will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Older Property with some nice updates, but still showing it's age; Bring your own Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: ROBnMO
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in March of 2012 for business, just a quick, one-night stay. The location is really easy to find and is convenient, close to the highway and near the Downtown area and the Branson Landing. Although it is technically on the Branson Strip, it's fairly far from where the tourist attractions are. Check-in was quick, the older lady was very friendly and even offered good advice on a little pizza place that was very good. I went up to my room and noticed that the elevator (only one) was fairly old and was not kept up. When I gotto my floor, I noticed scuffs up and down the hallway walls, which was surprising since the carpeting looked fairly new. I got to my room, and noticed some newer furniture and a nice TV. So far, so good. Looking in the bathroom, the spa tub from the 1980's stuck out like a sore thumb. New sink, new tile, but old tub, and the jetted tub didn't work - where the controls were supposed to be, only a blank wall plate. Oh well, no spa tub for me. But what that did is leave a small, outdated tub. The room was warm, so I turned the A/C on. It ran for a few minutes, then quit. Seems that the AC units cycle off a bit. I turned the fan on, lowered the thermostat to 65, but it still seemed to be on some kind of timer? I'm glad it wasn't August... The room itself was very nice, with newer carpeting and furniture. TV reception was pretty bad, though - I kept losing the TV signal. Wifi worked pretty well. A while later, I noticed I had forgotten shaving cream and a comb. Well, with the standard "Forgot Something?" sign in the bathroom offering compimentary toiletries, I called the front desk. Comb was a go, but the younger lady informed me they didn't have any shaving cream, but conditioner works well. No thanks. What bugged me here is that she told me "if you want one (comb), come down and get one.". I headed down, wondering why someone couldn't bring one up, when I discoved the clerk (a different gal than earlier) chatting with friends and eating her dinner. Ah, customer service at its best. What really caused the review to be marginal is the breakfast offered. The standard waffle maker and continental fare was laid out and looked good (in addition to biscuits and gravy), but after cooking my waffle and dishing out a biscuit and gravy, they tasted awful. I don't know how you can mess up waffle batter, but they did. The gravy tasted off as well, all confirmed with a travel companion I was with. I only ate a couple of bites before throwing away my plate and heading to McDonald's down the street. Very disappointing breakfast, and not a good way to start the morning before my business day started.

Reviews.Title: “NAIA National Tournament”
Reviews.Author: Craig H
Reviews.Content: Our basketball team (Davenport University) stayed here for 8 nights. The service that was provided was fantastic! We were greeted upon entrance with a smile and a warm welcoming every time. The continental breakfast in the morning was always up and running with an employee servicing each station every 5 minutes. The hotel was very clean, and the maids were very professional and did not relocate any personal items to clean. As we have had issues with past hotels and items have either come up misplaced. The location of this hotel was exceptional also! We were able to access the strip quickly, but also jump on the highway in seconds! I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting the Branson area!

Reviews.Title: “Not as advertised”
Reviews.Author: genesis16ministries
Reviews.Content: We had booked four nights here for a vacation and found that we needed to change hotels because of the amenities. My kids were set on playing in the pool and hot tub, but we found the hot tub was broken and boarded over and the pool was terribly cold and dirty. My kids were so upset. Overall the hotel was clean and decent and the staff was nice, but the pool needs to be kept up or not advertised. I was also disappointed in the location, definitely not a location for walking or riding bikes to destinations.

Reviews.Title: “Great Weekend Stay”
Reviews.Author: Weaselsmom12
Reviews.Content: We stayed with my daughter's volleyball team the weekend after the tornado hit. I am sure the hotel staff was busy assisting folks who had their home damaged by the storm, but they treated our entire group with great hospitality. The ladies went out of their way several times to get the girls extra hot chocolate and whatever else we needed. Great continental breakfast! Excellent value all the way around.

Reviews.Title: “Here on business, but great for vacation”
Reviews.Author: jrandolph
Reviews.Content: I came in the day after the tornado hit the strip in Branson. With my work, I am often in cities directly after a disaster of some kind. Usually, the hotel staff is noticeably absent, and the hotel service suffers as a result. Granted, that's understandable, and to be expected. But not at the Baymont. These folks welcomed me with a smile, held their head up high, and helped with any of my needs. not easy to do, but they did perfectly.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for a quick weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: SanibelSunset
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Baymont Inn this month for a weekend trip...hotel & staff were very accommodating, the only drawbacks I noticed were a)thin walls as someone else had mentioned, we could hear the t.v. next door; b)a little noisy from the traffic as the hotel is very close to the street; and c)the breakfast buffet was very limited (they had run out of milk that morning also). However the pluses were a)very clean room & the carpets looked to be recently replaced; and b)a good location on the strip right off of the interstate. So no major complaints, I wouldn't hesitate to stay here if I got a great price again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Baymont to stay at”
Reviews.Author: wolfhollow
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and it is a great place. Staff was fantastic, friendly and helpful- I had a little self imposed problem with the TV and walked down to the desk to inform them- I went back to my room and in less than 2 minutes Mike showed up and fixed the issue- he is a great,funny guy that becomes an instant friend. All the staff were well informed on Branson, good advice on things. Buffet was great and again -super staff. Complaints- None- we have found a new home for our Branson stays. A really nice hotel and great location.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Edward P
Reviews.Content: We had a 5 night stay and really enjoyed it. The staff was just wonderful...very friendly and helpful people. The room was clean and the bed, very comfortable. The hotel can be a bit of a challenge to enter and exit due to "the strip" traffic. Also, if the hotel is full it can be a challenge to find a parking spot in the parking lot. Overall a very good value.

Reviews.Title: “All A's but one D-”
Reviews.Author: 09gr
Reviews.Content: Just finished a 5-night stay there and would give an A for just about everything. Nice staff, comfortable bed, flat screen TV, coffee maker, fridge, microwave, reasonable rates, quiet, nice breakfast area, location. Alas, there would be a D- for the lighting in the room ... very dim even in bathroom, making it difficult to read, do hair, apply make-up and find things. We had no idea what we looked like in the morning (which may have been good thing :-).

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: kristie1230
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights while in Branson. It is a newer, very nice hotel. Great location just off 65. The desk and breakfast staff are very friendly and helpful. Check in and check out was easy and quick. Breakfast was good/standard variety and the breakfast seating room was great. Large windows with a nice view of trees and foliage. Nice little business room with computer access and printer just off the lobby and breakfast room. 24 hour coffee in the lobby with cookies in the evening. Our room was nice and comfortable with just 2 complaints - the room lighting was too dim. Too dark to read anything. And the air conditioning was difficult to regulate. Either warm and stuffy or cold blowing air. We didn't use the pool or hot tub. Overall, this is a very nice place to stay. Our rate was reasonable for the quality of the hotel. After getting to Branson we found that there are less expensive places available but not quite as nice. Personal preference should decide.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place”
Reviews.Author: ironriver
Reviews.Content: We booked here for the central location and the ease of getting off Hwy. 65 after a long trip here. We spent a lot of time downtown as it was 3 minutes away and also used the Blue Route just up the hill from the motel to get to various places on the Strip. Good breakfast here and plenty of room in the breakfast room. Very cordial desk staff that always wanted to hear about our daily activities and shows. Would book it again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with courteous staff!”
Reviews.Author: maplemtn
Reviews.Content: Easy to reach all our destinations from this location. Breakfast was okay. Rooms were clean and very stylish. Enjoyed our stay. My only complaint is that it's been 4 months and I still have not received my membership card. The business card only gives the Tripadivsor web site and no direct contact information.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean. We would stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: 4stella4
Reviews.Content: The rooms were very clean and all of the staff were very friendly and helpful. My husband and I both loved the beds, although the pillows were too plush for my husband. We slept so well at night. The hotel itself was very easy to find. I really have no complaints with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lovetotravel1987
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel 3 times and find it to be very tastefully decorated (newly renovated in 2010), and comfortable. I stayed on the second floor and found the shower to have good water pressure - a must for me. A continental breakfast is served each morning, and on the weekends, a hot entree is served as well (usually biscuits with sausage gravy). Another plus is that the hotel is located jus blocks from the Branson Landing Shopping Center and River.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and pet friendly, too”
Reviews.Author: jdeuce26
Reviews.Content: One of the nicest pet friendly hotels I have ever stayed at. Friendly staff, nice rooms, clean bathrooms, comfy beds and pillows, thick towels, great breakfast, and an ideal location in Branson. Excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel”
Reviews.Author: german143
Reviews.Content: I have traveled all over the world but this is my third time to Branson Baymont. The reason? You have a very good staff and beds are comfortable but one person stands out........ Mary C. It is a joy to watch her intermingle with guests and still keep her area in order. There is more to this lady than meets the eye. Manzgement should pick up on this!

Reviews.Title: “Our new hotel of choice in Branson!”
Reviews.Author: Lockestar
Reviews.Content: Great room for a weekend getaway! We stayed in the king room with jaccuzzi! It had an LCD tv refrig. And microwave walk in shower that was a bit on small size but who cares because we had the jaccuzzi! Great room to come to at the end of a busy day! Bed was comfortable and pillows were great! TheY stocked enough towels and the staff was friendly! Indoor pool and spa!

Reviews.Title: “Good stay for the price.”
Reviews.Author: Occasi0nalVacati0ner
Reviews.Content: We arrived late on a Friday night and had an reservation and had a great check-in experience with the front desk. However, the parking lot wasn't fully scraped and the sidewalks were a bit icy (potential hazard). The beds and pillows were comfortable, and I was 8 months pregnant at the time and have difficulty getting comfortable in my condition. However, the heater was loud and refrigerator made random noises. Our room was a king size bed with a jacuzzi, and was unfortunately right next to the fitness room. We were awakened very early the next morning by guests working out on the equipment and loud sounds of running water. The continental breakfast was a free and was typical based on my experience in various hotels (muffins, cereal, juice, yogurt, french toast, etc). The staff was extremely friendly and courteous during the entire stay. The shower is extremely small and extremely difficult to maneuver in for a tall and pregant woman. My husband also complained about it's size though. I was able to relax in the jacuzzi later and worked great and had hot water. Spent day out and didn't get back until late and my husband had to park extremely far away and not in an area designated for parking because the lot was full (since the snow hadn't all been removed, it was taking a lot of space). Luckily we weren't towed though. During our second night, the sounds of running water continued to be quite loud and would often wake me up. My husband had no problems (but he sleeps through almost anything). The morning shower on the second day was impossible - there was literally no hot water and the front desk stated that they were almost at full capacity and apologized for the inconvenience. Also realized that morning that our refrigerator didn't actually work and our food that we had put in it the night before was spoiled. For two nights, our visit was about $155 total. Based on prices for other hotels in the area, we had a great price - so I'm not one to complain about a few inconviences. Was a great location for going to both Branson Landing and the main road of Branson attractions. Room was completely clean and I didn't see any bugs that others have spoke of. Since it was during the off-season, I would think that the hot water issue should definitely be addressed though.

Reviews.Title: “make sure you know what you're getting before staying here"”
Reviews.Author: crane58
Reviews.Content: i found an offer on email I got from Branson tourist info for a New Years Eve package offer from the Baymont Inn and Suites-get commemorative glasses, bottle of sparkling wine, continental bkfst and transportation to and back from the Legends show. what they neglected to tell me when I called and made the reservation was that I had to make my own reservations for show. stupid me-I thought that when I booked they would do that and I would pay on arrival. they also neglected to tell me that there was an extra charge to take us there-the venue is less than 6 blocks away- and pick us up. Needless to say we did not attend. As I explained to the manager-If we have to make our own reservations and pay extra to be driven there and picked up then it isn't much of a package, is It? I also told him had I been told of this when I called that we would not have stayed there, but since we could not cancel we stayed. the room was only OK-huge whirlpool tub in room had spiders, coffee maker spewed coffee all over when my husband made a cup, bed hard, walls thin(our neighbors were frisky and religous-she must have moaned" Oh my God" at least 20 times). shower very small-if you're over 5'8" and 150 lb it would be difficult. the breakfast was only doughnuts, biscuits, cereal, apples, etc. the best thing was th coffee and the friendly breakfast servers. we left by 8 AM. The manager did apologize, took off charge for transportation, let us keep the wine. I cannot in all honesty recommend this property.

Reviews.Title: “Decent holiday stay.”
Reviews.Author: Campuscop
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights the week before Christmas. This hotel used to be the Holiday Inn Express several years ago. The hotel staff was extremely friendly. The hotel was not crowded as it was the off season. I was not impressed with the price. I had booked a two night stay in which I was given an online discount (from the hotels website) of 51.00 per night for staying two or more nights. A single night was about 69.00. We decided to arrive one night early. They would not give me the two or more night rate as it was a different reservation. The clerk did give me the AAA discount though. The lobby was clean, our room was on the third floor. The hotel has 5 floors. There was only one elevator but it was quick. Upon entering the room, it was very clean. We walked around in socks, and they did not turn black so the carpet was clean. The flat screen LCD tv's were a nice touch with full cable and a lot of channels. I did use the WIFI and it worked good and fast. Our room faced away from the highway so there was no traffic noise. The heater was a little bit louder than I was used too. Also you could hear the foot traffic in the hallway a bit more than some other places. The beds were comfy and came with 4 pillows each. The bathroom was clean and had a jet tub. However, I am 6'0 tall and I could easily touch the ceiling with my hands. The shower nozzle would be lower than most but I made do with it. The water pressure was good but the water temp was not consistant. I like hot water but out of nowhere the water turned extremely hot and then went back to where I had it set. I noticed it did this the next day as well. So be careful with that. The continental breakfast included dry cereal, breads, fruits, and waffles and slices of french toast to be put in the toaster. I had the french toast each day. There was also apple and orange juice and even hot cocoa which my daughter loved. Yea it was free so it was good for me. There was also an indoor pool and indoor hot tub. We did not use it but it looked clean and there were guests using it each time we passed by it.

Reviews.Title: “Best value near Branson Landing”
Reviews.Author: Matt501
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a spot near Branson Landing and downtown Branson and don't want to pay the high rates at the Hilton, the Baymont Inn is your best option. It is not within walking distance like the Best Western, but from what I could tell it is a nicer place to stay and still just a very short drive away. The rooms seemed newly updated and designed nicely, and they were very clean. Room also had a flat-screen television in it. I got a great rate by paying when I reserved the room (which means no cancellations). Complaints: The water in the shower on Sunday morning only got to the "tolerable" range, and the TV in the free breakfast room was blaring that offensive Fox News nonsense.

Reviews.Title: “They need to try just a little harder!”
Reviews.Author: LaVerne B
Reviews.Content: Need to keep up with repairs. Saw too many animals using hotel while I was there. Beds are very comfortable, and breakfast is very appealing.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the price”
Reviews.Author: Hokiechip
Reviews.Content: Although this was not our first choice in Branson, a veterans event created a shortage of rooms in Branson so we took a chance. Overall, it was a good experience - not great, but acceptable. Although the Whirlpool in the room was nice, the shower was extremely small and cramped. I'm only 6 foot tall, but it was a real challenge to wash my hair as the shower head was probably 5 feet off the floor. The staff was generally nice, although I did hear the front desk clerk snap at someone on the phone that "that rate is only good on the internet." That was probably company policy, but the tone was not very friendly. If you stay here, do request a rtoom on the back of the hotel as the hotel is next to the main highway through town.

Reviews.Title: “Our room was smelly”
Reviews.Author: ld87
Reviews.Content: Me and husband stayed overnight here last weekend. The hotel was very clean but was not as new as I had hoped. The room are decorated very nice. But we got a jacuzzi tub suite and it was cramped, and when we first walked in smelled like rubbing alcohol.?? But we figured it was just from the cleaning.(?) And we got used to the smell. Overall it was a nice place to stay, it is in a bad location for traffic and such but the hotel was clean and the staff friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for a very discerning and discriminating group.”
Reviews.Author: DLELongview
Reviews.Content: Most impressed with the people from the manager to the desk folks to Mary and others who handles the breakfast. If you desire a large, traditional breakfast, Bob Evans is across the street. Our group was happy with the continental options. Handy location at the south end of the strip near Branson Landing. Our priorities for hotels are: clean, good food, and friendly individuals working. We did not have 1 gripe for our 3 night stay with 35 senior adults. Many compliments on the beds and how comfortable they were. Flat screen televisions were nice touch. From the look, thought it was a brand new hotel. Very clean! You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “treated like family by friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: dlklippen
Reviews.Content: Great location, good value, friendly & accommodating staff. Liz - the first to greet us and always helpful to solve any extra needs our group had, Isabel - friendly and always smiling (and pretty too), Mary - our breakfast host who fussed over us like a Mom, Matt - quick to fix our minor maintenance issue and Regina and Rafal and any others I missed - thanks for making our stay there feel like home away from home. God bless and hope to see you again.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: german143
Reviews.Content: Our stay was very nice. The rooms are very comfortable but the reason we are writing is to comment on the staff. Liz and Isabella handled our needs very well but the person who stands out on your staff is Mary. She was loaded down with people but handled a couple of situations efficent and with kid gloves. It was a joy to watch her and hear her call the little ones by name and give them "high fives" If I had a hotel you would have a hard time keeping this lady. I would steal her at any price. What a jewel!!!!!we will come back just to see her again!

Reviews.Title: “Find Someplace Else To Stay”
Reviews.Author: OKJoJoJo
Reviews.Content: The air conditioner would come on and off. Going off it would make a loud whoosing sound and then finally it would come back on with a loud whoosing sound. We ended up putting it on 66 just to try and keep it going and not staring and stopping that didn't help. The pool is indoors but it was so hot inside that area that we ended up opening the entrance door just to get some air. plus you must walk down two flights of stairs to get to the pool. On Friday morning August 13th, at around 8:00 a.m. we were woke up by laughing and talking out in the hall area. I thought it must be a Jr. High Group getting ready to leave the hotel it was so loud. Finally I got up to see who was out in the hall making all that noise. It was the Laundry Workers --- our room was right across the hall from the laundry. They were working in there folding towels and sheets visiting and laughing up a storm. I couldn't believe all that noise was coming from the staff that woke us all up. Our room with the taxes was $94.00. I will not stay there again. Please be warned.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, except for the loud water pipes and the totally unprofessional staff.”
Reviews.Author: kristina8710
Reviews.Content: Let's start with the pros: The Baymont Inn and Suites is right off the highway in Branson, and pretty centrally located, having the Branson Landing about a mile or two away on one side and the Tanger Outlet Mall, etc about two miles away on the other side. It is very clean. It smells clean, it looks clean, and it is completely smoke-free. The rooms are updated. In person, they look like the pictures online. Nice linens, soft beds, pretty lamps, the whole nine. And for the cons: When the neighbors took a shower (at almost 11pm), it sounded like Niagara Falls was next door. Upon our arrival, we had a hard time parking near the door because there was a big truck parked there. The driver was having a discussion with a female hospitality worker who was very obviously pregnant... and smoking a cigarette. The other hospitality workers were inside the lobby sitting on the couches, waiting on their rides home, talking loudly to each other and just, overall, acting obnoxious. Others of them stepped out to smoke, right where customers were walking in. I think these workers deserve a designated place to sit after their shift as well as a certain place where they can go, on their breaks and after their shifts, if they need a cigarette. Anyway, as a traveler, it was kind of distracting and irritating.

Reviews.Title: “Could have been better”
Reviews.Author: GodsGal
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Baymont Inn and Suites in Branson for the sole reason we believed it was a brand new hotel. It wasn't. It had been refurbished and evidentally that was their idea of brand new. It was a very old hotel and the bathrooms had not been refurbished that we could tell (very old bathtub, toilet and sink). The elevator was run down and I chose the stairs since I didn't trust it. It would be a nice hotel if you only pay between $50.00 - $60.00, but we ended up paying $87.00 for this place. All other hotels in the area were booked, so we couldn't leave. Most of the staff were friendly, and the free breakfast was adequate (but wouldn't recommend staying there for the breakfast!)

Reviews.Title: “Great price , great location, beautiful remodeled rooms!!”
Reviews.Author: Unclevinny187
Reviews.Content: I wanted to find a hotel that was upscale but not to expensive and I found this one and I'm so glad I did my wife and I were impressed with everything !! We will definitely stay in this hotel when we come back to Branson !!! Don't listen to the other stupid reviews this is a 4 star hotel !! And great price too!!

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: pittielove
Reviews.Content: The location is great and the service is friendly. However, the bathtub had soap/shampoo gunk on it, and there was hair on the toilet, vanity and bathtub (I assumed it was the housekeeper's). The linens and all else were clean. We didn't have breakfast there, but it looked okay (a mix of hot and cold basics). We booked this room at a discounted rate and were thus not disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Motel with Great Amenities and Staff”
Reviews.Author: LoveToTravel944
Reviews.Content: This motel gave me a GREAT EXPERIENCE! Although probably a 3 star motel, I had a 5 star experience. All the staff were friendly, courteous and helpful. I would especially like to acknowledge the help of 4 staff members. 1> Regina, the overnight front desk clerk. I have limited computer capabilities and arthritis in my hands. She spent nearly 2 hours with me helping me find the best deal and flight times for a trip to Orlando starting Aug. 9. 2> Mary, in charge of the continental breakfast. She greeted everyone in a friendly and courteous manner and made everyone feel at home in the best Ozarks tradition. She was always willing to get me something that may have not been out that morning. 3> Liz, the PM front desk clerk. When there was a shrill, loud barking dog in the room next to mine, without my asking, she moved me to a far better room at the other end of the hall. It even had a jacuzzi in it. There were so many complaints from other guests about their dog, they were asked to leave the motel. 4> Isabella, the AM front desk clerk. Although very busy, she provided great help to me in booking my flight to Orlando between guests. There was a 4 page form and I spent about 40 minutes on the first page because I had entered two adults and two senior adults so was booking for 4 when I wanted 2. She found the error for me and saved me a lot of time. Amenties and rooms - The motel had been completely redone in 2009 and was very modern and had such features as in-room features as safe, small refrigerator, microwave, iron with board, hair dryer, etc. I would compare it with a good Hampton Inn. About me: I have traveled to over 20 foreign countries (13 of them for 6 to 24 weeks), many states and spent many years living out of hotels/motels. I spent many years working for US Government with a Top Secret clearance.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: queeni814
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 days - nice hotel . The room was very clean , bath tub a little small, hallway was always very HOT. Room seemed to take a while to cool down. Ask for room on backside if traffic noise bothers you ! The breakfast was only cold cereal, different toast items , coffee , milk & juice - nothing special- but hey it was free ! All personal where very nice & had a lot of good suggestions for the different attactions & eating places .

Reviews.Title: “A little small but adequate”
Reviews.Author: EdnaJune
Reviews.Content: Our room at the Baymont was a little on the small side, but adequate for two people. The AC barely did an adequate job; I turned the thermostat down to the 60's, which I typically NEVER do! The room was clean and the bed was comfortable. The breakfast was OK, although more hot food would have been better (toaster waffles and french toast). Our room was on the side away from the street, very quiet, with a nice big tree outside. The staff there is outstanding, very friendly and helpful in every way.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay again!!!!”
Reviews.Author: luv2shop70
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel very late in the evening, a day early, and very tired. The hotel clerk was very helpful and was able to accomodate the day early arrival. We were also given a discount that the hotel was currently running and we stayed the extra night for almost no extra money! The hotel was quiet, the bed was comfortable, and the jacuzzi was very nice as well. Could not get over how clean the room was. This will be our "go to" hotel for Branson from now on!!! We ate breakfast on the last day only and regret that we had not eaten it the other 4 mornings!! The homemade gravy was great!!!

Reviews.Title: “A refreshing change to "standard" hotels”
Reviews.Author: lilkels04
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Baymont with my mom in April 2010. We had amazing hospitality, very clean facility, and an experience that will bring us back to Branson. Thank you Baymont staff! --Mary C rocks---

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: kitty74146
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for spring break. The rooms are very clean; the carpet, bedding and furnishings are new. The staff was great, especially Isabel at the front desk. Also the manager worked very hard in the mornings to stock up the breakfast area. It also has free parking, pool, business center and small gym. We will definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, but had to adjust to management.”
Reviews.Author: kalebt1997
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice. It was clean and very well decorated. All of our group enjoyed it. We had to adjust to management. At first, they weren't all that excited that there was a group. But they adjusted and became really good friends.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful start & finish for our Branson weekend!”
Reviews.Author: YummyFoodFanboy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right off of 65N/76. Clean fun pool, exercise room was a surprise attraction (2 - 10 yr old boys burned off alot of energy then pool!). Spent the evening in Branson, back to swimming then comfy rooms. Quiet considering the amount of other guests. Internet & Cable kept us occupied til bedtime. Very nice assortment of breakfast items included with our stay. After check out we headed for Branson Landing which is just across 65, so everything was quick and easy. Friendly helpful staff & management. No complaints and this is our second stay. Will recommend and stay again! Thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel experience that I have had in a long time”
Reviews.Author: Beckymissouri
Reviews.Content: The customer service was terrific. All the staff were friendly and helpful. The hotel was very clean and was in a great location. We did not have to drive far to do the things we wanted to do. This hotel set a wonderful tone to our stay in Branson. We will definately return.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff, nice location and pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: sharonElkhartin
Reviews.Content: Very central location and staff most willing to answer our questions regarding restaurants and local attractions. We stayed two days and will certainly go back as there is alot to do in Branson and the surrounding locations. It was a most pleasant experience staying at the Baymont and we would stay there again. Price was GREAT!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: jbackes
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised at how nice this motel was. We arrived shortly before check-in time, but they had a room ready for us. The front desk attendant was friendly and informative. The lady who put out the complimentary breakfast was also very friendly and helpful (usually this person is nowhere to be found). The room was clean, spacious, and tastefully decorated. The TV was up-to-date, and the bed was comfortable. If I had a suggestion to make, I'd say more lighting. Even with all of the lights on, I could barely see to sort things in my luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't be better”
Reviews.Author: diDuluth
Reviews.Content: Friendly and helpful woman at the desk 3/8/10 - room was very clean, included jacuzzi at no extra cost. Price well below what we expected but it was still off-season. Would definitely plan to stay there next time in Branson. Convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “I will book again”
Reviews.Author: Sportandsissy
Reviews.Content: We drove thru Branson and this was the first hotel we saw. Looked completely updated. We're coming back in the Spring to visit the town itself and I would recommend staying here. Nice breakfast. Friendly staff. Pretty good rates. Don't know if all rooms were as updated as ours, but it looked brand new to me. Plus, don't know if being February and just us old people were there, but it was very, very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience. My hotel of choice when I am in Branson”
Reviews.Author: Katie1959
Reviews.Content: I travel alot for my job. And I stay in alot of hotels. By far, the Baymont Inn in Branson is my new favorite. I will stay there from now on when I am in Branson - which is often. Very clean and comfy, the staff is so friendly, which is important after a long day on the road. Convenient, great value..... I could go on and on. Thank you to the staff at the Baymont Inn. See you again soon! And..... I will be back for this spring for an actual vacation - not business!!! Looking forward to it!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel, look no further”
Reviews.Author: RachaelLaRock
Reviews.Content: The Baymont Inn in Branson was so awesome! It was very easy to find off of the main highway and was located near everything we wanted to see. The rate was very low, making me wonder if it could be as good a quality as we wanted. We arrived late and were welcomed by the staff there. Even though it was after hours, the staffperson on duty let my children swim anyway and even gave us cocoa afterward! Our room could not have been cleaner had it been the White House. The breakfast in the morning was wonderful, had some healthy choices as well as not so healthy :). We had a great time and I would highly reccomend anyone who is going to Branson to stay with the Baymont Inn. I had read some reviews that were not so positive but they must have been before the renovation last Fall. The entire hotel looked new, clean, and nice and the staff went out of their way to make sure we were comfortable, had a good time, and had everything we needed. We will definitely return to the Baymont Inn the next time we are in Branson.

HotelInfo.Name: Baymont Inn & Suites Branson-On the Strip
HotelInfo.Address: 1000 West Main Street, on The 76 Strip at Hwy 65, Branson, MO 65616
